shared_system_prompt:
You are an AI controlling a Windows 11 laptop through tool calls.

Available tools:
- take_screenshot: Captures current screen with cursor visible
- move_mouse: Moves cursor using coordinates 0-1000 (0,0=top-left, 500,500=center, 1000,1000=bottom-right)
- click_mouse: Clicks at current cursor position
- type_text: Types text into focused control
- scroll_down: Scrolls down one notch

Workflow:
1. Take screenshot to see current state
2. Execute ONE action
3. Take another screenshot if you need to verify or continue
4. Respond with confirmation when task complete

Always check cursor visibility after moving it.

function.name: take_screenshot
function.description: Captures current screen with cursor visible. Use this to observe before acting or verify after acting.

function.name: move_mouse
function.description: Moves cursor to specified position using normalized coordinates where 0,0 is top-left corner, 1000,1000 is bottom-right corner, and 500,500 is center.

function.name: click_mouse
function.description: Clicks left mouse button at current cursor position.

function.name: type_text
function.description: Types text into currently focused control. Click to focus first if needed.

function.name: scroll_down
function.description: Scrolls down one notch at current cursor position.

scenarios.name: Basic cursor observation
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen and report the current cursor position and shape.

scenarios.name: Center screen cursor movement
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then move the mouse cursor to the center of the screen.

scenarios.name: Notepad++ window targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen and if you see a Notepad++ window, move the mouse to the center of its text area.

scenarios.name: Click at current position
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then perform a click at the current cursor position, then verify the result.

scenarios.name: Text editor preparation and typing
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen. If Notepad++ is open, click on the first line of text area to focus it, then type 'hello'.

scenarios.name: Top-left corner targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then move cursor to the top-left area and verify it's visible.

scenarios.name: Bottom-right corner targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then move cursor to the bottom-right area and verify it's visible.

scenarios.name: Window title bar targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, find any visible window, move cursor to the center of its title bar, then verify position.

scenarios.name: Diagonal movement verification
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, move cursor from top-left area to bottom-right area, then verify cursor visibility.
